metadata.dc:description: A 17 years old female with hepatosplenomegaly and pulmonary infiltrates since the age of four is presented. Sea-blue histiocyte disease, a sphingolipidosis, was diagnosed by liver biopsy, bone marrow aspirate and bronchoalveolar lavage. The relevance of bronchoalveolar lavage as a diagnostic method in cases of systemic diseases with pulmonary involvement is emphasized.
metadata.dc:title: Valor del lavado broncoalveolar en el diagnostico de las enfermedades de deposito con compromiso pulmonar.
[Value of bronchoalveolar lavage in the diagnosis of pulmonary involvement in storage diseases].
